intro: Paederia farinosa subsp. farinosa, commonly known as the hairy paederia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, palmately lobed leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the warmer months. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
